enum.name: BOUNDARY_TYPE
enum.description: Type of boundary items being requested/sent in boundary protocol.

entry.name: OPERATIONAL_FENCE
entry.description: Items are operational boundary coniditions constraining the AO. Often this will be used to describe the general allowable flight area for all vehicles.

entry.name: RESOURCE_FENCE
entry.description: Items are operational boundary conditions that may be a subset of the operational fence. Often used while tasking resources and determining the general area each agent should be concerned with.

entry.name: GENERIC_POLYGON
entry.description: Items are described for a general polygon.

enum.name: BOUNDARY_RESULT
enum.description: Result in a mavlink boundary ack.

entry.name: BOUNDARY_ERROR
entry.description: Generic error / not accepting boundary commands at all right now.

entry.name: BOUNDARY_INVALID
entry.description: One of the parameters has an invalid value.

entry.name: BOUNDARY_INVALID_SEQUENCE
entry.description: Received boundary item out of sequence.

entry.name: BOUNDARY_DENIED
entry.description: Not accepting any boundary commands from this communication partner.

entry.name: BOUNDARY_DOES_NOT_EXIST
entry.description: The requested boundary with the associated key does not exist.

message.name: NEW_BOUNDARY_OBJECT
message.field: System ID
Creator ID
Boundary type, see BOUNDARY_TYPE.
Number to identifiy boundary on host.
The vehicle that boundary applies to.
Number of vehicles that the boundary contains.

message.name: BOUNDARY_ACK
message.field: System ID
Creator ID
Number to identifiy boundary on host.
The acknowledgement result associated, see BOUNDARY_RESULT.

message.name: BOUNDARY_REQUEST_LIST
message.field: System ID
Creator ID
Number to identifiy boundary on host.

message.name: BOUNDARY_COUNT
message.field: System ID
Creator ID
Number to identifiy boundary on host.
Number of items defining the boundary.

message.name: BOUNDARY_REQUEST_ITEM
message.field: System ID
Creator ID
Number to identifiy boundary on host.
Item index within the bonudary sequence.

message.name: BOUNDARY_ITEM
message.field: System ID
Creator ID
Number to identifiy boundary on host.
The coordinate system of the boundary. see MAV_FRAME in mavlink_types.h
PARAM5 / local: x position, global: latitude.
PARAM6 / y position: global: longitude.
PARAM7 / z position: global: altitude (relative or absolute, depending on frame.
Item index within the bonudary sequence.
